pages.title: Dollyphyton
pages.text: $(l)Temporal Range:$() Ordovician$(br2)$(l)Habitat:$() Near water$(br2)$(l)Propagation:$() Spore/seed collection envelope$(br)$(l)Method of Obtaining:$() Shears

Dollyphyton and Edwardsiphyton are somewhat contentious fossils found in the Douglas Lake Member of the Lenoir Limestone. The fossil impressions are not easy to interpret but Dollyphyton resembles mosses of the same group as modern Sphagnum.
